text: Zdraveite, my name is Milen from Bulgaria - Marketing Manager. Nice to be here!

You can't stage blogs but you can use the design manager preview if the data itself isn't changing significantly. Otherwise i create a dummy blog and work if of that until I'm ready to make the live blog have the template.

We've a HubSpot client who's looking for an online community platform (mini linkedin kinda thing). Does HubSpot provide anything along those lines? a la <http://community.HubSpot.com|community.HubSpot.com> I guess?
No, HubSpot doesnâ€™t offer that.  That site is powered by Lithium FYI

Hi! I am new to HubSpot CMS, but a seasoned developer with Bootstrap, HTML, CSS, .NET, C#, VB, and SQL experience plus Shopify and Wordpress platforms.  We are wrapping up our prototypes and getting ready for development. I have a few questions:
1) Where do you start to build your base styles (i.e. create your own style sheet with brand colors, Typekit fonts, etc or use the settings in HubSpot?)
2) What is the grid HubSpot uses based on? Is it Bootstrap or something else?
3) Is there a "guide" to the css files HubSpot includes? I'm looking for something similar to what bootstrap provides for making images responsive, setting column sizes, hiding on mobile devices, etc.

We usually start building in a new style sheet ignoring the HubSpot settings.
HubSpot is based on Bootstrap.
I am not sure of any particular guide to the base css files.
Hi! My name is Angela, I'm new here and wanted to say "Hello" from the City of Brotherly Love (Philadelphia, PA, USA).

The online community platform we use is Mighty Networks - for us is a perfect fit, but do check it out and feel free to DM me if you'd like some user/host perspectives (we moved our global community from our previous custom dev just over 1 year ago) <https://www.mightynetworks.com/>
Thank you for taking the time to reply. Do you happen to know which version of Boostrap HubSpot uses? My thought is to develop locally and upload files into modules and templates when finished.
